list.title: Actions#getActions
list.description:
Retrieves the current action sequence builder.
The actions builder can be used to chain multiple browser actions.

list.title: AddText#byClassName
list.description: Adds text to an element identified by its class name.

list.title: AddText#byId
list.description: Adds text to an element identified by its ID.

list.title: AddText#byName
list.description: Adds text to an element identified by its name attribute.

list.title: AddText#bySelector
list.description: Adds text to an element identified by its CSS selector.

list.title: AddText#byXpath
list.description: Adds text to an element identified by its XPath.

list.title: AndroidCommand#shell
list.description:
Runs a shell command on the connected Android device.
This method requires the Android device to be properly configured.

list.title: AndroidCommand#shellAsRoot
list.description:
Runs a shell command on the connected Android device as the root user.
This method requires the Android device to be properly configured and that you
rooted the device.

list.title: Cache#clear
list.description:
Clears the browser cache. This includes both cache and cookies.

For Firefox, it uses the extensionServer setup with specific options.
For Chrome and Edge, it uses the Chrome DevTools Protocol (CDP) commands.
If the browser is not supported, logs an error message.

list.title: Cache#clearKeepCookies
list.description:
Clears the browser cache while keeping the cookies.

For Firefox, it uses the extensionServer setup with specific options.
For Chrome and Edge, it uses the Chrome DevTools Protocol (CDP) command to clear the cache.
If the browser is not supported, logs an error message.

list.title: ChromeDevelopmentToolsProtocol#getRawClient
list.description: Retrieves the raw client for the DevTools Protocol.

list.title: ChromeDevelopmentToolsProtocol#on
list.description: Sets up an event listener for a specific DevTools Protocol event.

list.title: ChromeDevelopmentToolsProtocol#send
list.description: Sends a command to the DevTools Protocol.

list.title: ChromeDevelopmentToolsProtocol#sendAndGet
list.description: Sends a command to the DevTools Protocol and returns the result.

list.title: ChromeTrace#start
list.description: Starts the Chrome trace collection.

list.title: ChromeTrace#stop
list.description: Stops the Chrome trace collection, processes the collected data, and attaches it to the result object.

list.title: Click#byClassName
list.description: Clicks on an element identified by its class name.

list.title: Click#byClassNameAndWait
list.description: Clicks on an element identified by its class name and waits for the page complete check to finish.

list.title: Click#byId
list.description: Clicks on an element located by its ID.

list.title: Click#byIdAndWait
list.description: Click on link located by the ID attribute. Uses document.getElementById() to find the element. And wait for page complete check to finish.

list.title: Click#byJs
list.description: Clicks on an element located by evaluating a JavaScript expression.

list.title: Click#byJsAndWait
list.description: Clicks on an element located by evaluating a JavaScript expression and waits for the page complete check to finish.

list.title: Click#byLinkText
list.description: Clicks on a link whose visible text matches the given string.

list.title: Click#byLinkTextAndWait
list.description: Clicks on a link whose visible text matches the given string and waits for the page complete check to finish.

list.title: Click#byName
list.description: Clicks on an element located by its name attribute.

list.title: Click#byPartialLinkText
list.description: Clicks on a link whose visible text contains the given substring.

list.title: Click#byPartialLinkTextAndWait
list.description: Clicks on a link whose visible text contains the given substring and waits for the page complete check to finish.

list.title: Click#bySelector
list.description: Clicks on an element located by its CSS selector.

list.title: Click#bySelectorAndWait
list.description: Clicks on an element located by its CSS selector and waits for the page complete check to finish.

list.title: Click#byXpath
list.description: Clicks on an element that matches a given XPath selector.

list.title: Click#byXpathAndWait
list.description: Clicks on an element that matches a given XPath selector and waits for the page complete check to finish.

list.title: ClickAndHold#atCursor
list.description: Clicks and holds at the current cursor position.

list.title: ClickAndHold#atPosition
list.description: Clicks and holds at the specified screen coordinates.

list.title: ClickAndHold#bySelector
list.description: Clicks and holds on an element that matches a given CSS selector.

list.title: ClickAndHold#byXpath
list.description: Clicks and holds on an element that matches a given XPath selector.

list.title: ClickAndHold#releaseAtPosition
list.description: Releases the mouse button at the specified screen coordinates.

list.title: ClickAndHold#releaseAtSelector
list.description: Releases the mouse button on an element matching the specified CSS selector.

list.title: ClickAndHold#releaseAtXpath
list.description: Releases the mouse button on an element matching the specified XPath.

list.title: Commands#action
list.description: Selenium's action sequence functionality.

list.title: Commands#addText
list.description: Provides functionality to add text to elements on a web page using various selectors.

list.title: Commands#android
list.description: Provides commands for interacting with an Android device.

list.title: Commands#cache
list.description: Manages the browser's cache.

list.title: Commands#cdp
list.description: Use the Chrome DevTools Protocol, available in Chrome and Edge.

list.title: Commands#click
list.description: Provides functionality to perform click actions on elements in a web page using various selectors.

list.title: Commands#debug
list.description:
Provides debugging capabilities within a browser automation script.
It allows setting breakpoints to pause script execution and inspect the current state.

list.title: Commands#element
list.description: Get Selenium's WebElements.

list.title: Commands#error
list.description: Add a text that will be an error attached to the current page.

list.title: Commands#js
list.description: Executes JavaScript in the browser context.

list.title: Commands#markAsFailure
list.description: Mark this run as an failure. Add a message that explains the failure.

list.title: Commands#measure
list.description: Provides functionality for measuring a navigation.

list.title: Commands#meta
list.description: Adds metadata to the user journey.

list.title: Commands#mouse
list.description: Interact with the page using the mouse.

list.title: Commands#mouse.clickAndHold
list.description: Provides functionality to click and hold elements on a web page using different strategies.

list.title: Commands#mouse.contextClick
list.description: Perform a context click (right-click) on elements in a web page.

list.title: Commands#mouse.doubleClick
list.description: Provides functionality to perform a double-click action on elements in a web page.

list.title: Commands#mouse.moveTo
list.description: Move the mouse cursor to elements or specific positions on a web page.

list.title: Commands#mouse.singleClick
list.description: Provides functionality to perform a single click action on elements or at specific positions in a web page.

list.title: Commands#navigate
list.description: Navigates to a specified URL and handles additional setup for a page visit.

list.title: Commands#navigation
list.description: Provides functionality to control browser navigation such as back, forward, and refresh actions.

list.title: Commands#screenshot
list.description: Takes and manages screenshots.

list.title: Commands#scroll
list.description: Provides functionality to control page scrolling in the browser.

list.title: Commands#select
list.description: Interact with a select element.

list.title: Commands#set
list.description: Sets values on HTML elements in the page.

list.title: Commands#stopWatch
list.description: Stopwatch utility for measuring time intervals.

list.title: Commands#switch
list.description: Switches context to different frames, windows, or tabs in the browser.

list.title: Commands#trace
list.description: Manages Chrome trace functionality, enabling custom profiling and trace collection in Chrome.

list.title: Commands#wait
list.description: Provides functionality to wait for different conditions in the browser.

list.title: ContextClick#atCursor
list.description: Performs a context click (right-click) at the current cursor position.

list.title: ContextClick#bySelector
list.description: Performs a context click (right-click) on an element that matches a given CSS selector.

list.title: ContextClick#byXpath
list.description: Performs a context click (right-click) on an element that matches a given XPath selector.

list.title: Debug#breakpoint
list.description:
Adds a breakpoint to the script. The browser will pause at the breakpoint, waiting for user input to continue.
This is useful for debugging and inspecting the browser state at a specific point in the script.

list.title: DoubleClick#atCursor
list.description: Performs a mouse double-click at the current cursor position.

list.title: DoubleClick#bySelector
list.description: Performs a mouse double-click on an element matching a given CSS selector.

list.title: DoubleClick#byXpath
list.description: Performs a mouse double-click on an element matching a given XPath selector.

list.title: Element#getByClassName
list.description: Finds an element by its class name.

list.title: Element#getByCss
list.description: Finds an element by its CSS selector.

list.title: Element#getById
list.description: Finds an element by its ID.

list.title: Element#getByName
list.description: Finds an element by its name attribute.

list.title: Element#getByXpath
list.description: Finds an element by its XPath.

list.title: GeckoProfiler#start
list.description: Starts the Gecko Profiler.

list.title: GeckoProfiler#stop
list.description: Stops the Gecko Profiler and processes the collected data.

list.title: JavaScript#run
list.description: Executes a JavaScript script.

list.title: JavaScript#runAndWait
list.description: Executes a JavaScript script and waits for the page complete check to finish.

list.title: JavaScript#runPrivileged
list.description: Executes synchronous privileged JavaScript.

list.title: JavaScript#runPrivilegedAndWait
list.description: Executes synchronous privileged JavaScript and waits for the page complete check to finish.

list.title: JavaScript#runPrivilegedAsync
list.description: Executes asynchronous privileged JavaScript.

list.title: Measure#add
list.description:
Adds a custom metric to the current measurement result.
This method should be called after a measurement has started and before it has stopped.

list.title: Measure#addObject
list.description:
Adds multiple custom metrics to the current measurement result.
This method accepts an object containing multiple key-value pairs representing different metrics.
Similar to `add`, it should be used within an active measurement cycle.

list.title: Measure#start
list.description:
Starts the measurement process for a given URL or an alias.

It supports starting measurements by either directly providing a URL or using an alias.
If a URL is provided, it navigates to that URL and performs the measurement.
If an alias is provided, or no URL is available, it sets up the environment for a user-driven navigation.

list.title: Measure#stop
list.description:
Stops the measurement process, collects metrics, and handles any post-measurement tasks.
It finalizes the URL being tested, manages any URL-specific metadata, stops any ongoing video recordings,
and initiates the data collection process.

list.title: Meta#setDescription
list.description: Sets the description for the user journey.

list.title: Meta#setTitle
list.description: Sets the title for the user journey.

list.title: MouseMove#byOffset
list.description: Moves the mouse cursor by an offset from its current position.

list.title: MouseMove#bySelector
list.description: Moves the mouse cursor to an element that matches a given CSS selector.

list.title: MouseMove#byXpath
list.description: Moves the mouse cursor to an element that matches a given XPath selector.

list.title: MouseMove#toPosition
list.description: Moves the mouse cursor to a specific position on the screen.

list.title: Navigation#back
list.description: Navigates backward in the browser's history.

list.title: Navigation#forward
list.description: Navigates forward in the browser's history.

list.title: Navigation#refresh
list.description: Refreshes the current page.

list.title: Screenshot#take
list.description: Takes a screenshot and saves it using the screenshot manager.

list.title: Scroll#byLines
list.description: Scrolls the page by the specified number of lines. This method is only supported in Firefox.

list.title: Scroll#byPages
list.description: Scrolls the page by the specified number of pages.

list.title: Scroll#byPixels
list.description: Scrolls the page by the specified number of pixels.

list.title: Scroll#toBottom
list.description: Scrolls to the bottom of the page, scrolling page by page with a delay between each scroll.

list.title: Select#deselectById
list.description: Deselects all options in a `<select>` element by its ID.

list.title: Select#getSelectedValueById
list.description: Retrieves the value of the selected option in a `<select>` element by its ID.

list.title: Select#getValuesById
list.description: Retrieves all option values in a `<select>` element by its ID.

list.title: Select#selectByIdAndIndex
list.description: Selects an option in a `<select>` element by its ID and the index of the option.

list.title: Select#selectByIdAndValue
list.description: Selects an option in a `<select>` element by its ID and the value of the option.

list.title: Select#selectByNameAndIndex
list.description: Selects an option in a `<select>` element by its name and the index of the option.

list.title: Select#selectByNameAndValue
list.description: Selects an option in a `<select>` element by its name and the value of the option.

list.title: Set#innerHtml
list.description: Sets the innerHTML of an element using a CSS selector.

list.title: Set#innerHtmlById
list.description: Sets the innerHTML of an element using its ID.

list.title: Set#innerText
list.description: Sets the innerText of an element using a CSS selector.

list.title: Set#innerTextById
list.description: Sets the innerText of an element using its ID.

list.title: Set#value
list.description: Sets the value of an element using a CSS selector.

list.title: Set#valueById
list.description: Sets the value of an element using its ID.

list.title: SingleClick#atCursor
list.description: Performs a single mouse click at the current cursor position.

list.title: SingleClick#atCursorAndWait
list.description:
Performs a single mouse click at the current cursor position and waits on the
page complete check.

list.title: SingleClick#byLinkText
list.description: Clicks on a link whose visible text matches the given string.

list.title: SingleClick#byLinkTextAndWait
list.description: Clicks on a link whose visible text matches the given string and waits on the opage complete check.

list.title: SingleClick#byPartialLinkText
list.description: Clicks on a link whose visible text contains the given substring.

list.title: SingleClick#byPartialLinkTextAndWait
list.description:
Clicks on a link whose visible text contains the given substring and waits on the
page complete checl.

list.title: SingleClick#bySelector
list.description: Performs a single mouse click on an element matching a given CSS selector.

list.title: SingleClick#bySelectorAndWait
list.description: Performs a single mouse click on an element matching a given CSS selector and waits on the page complete check.

list.title: SingleClick#byXpath
list.description: Performs a single mouse click on an element matching a given XPath selector.

list.title: SingleClick#byXpathAndWait
list.description: Performs a single mouse click on an element matching a given XPath selector and wait for page complete check.

list.title: StopWatch#getName
list.description: Gets the name of the stopwatch.

list.title: StopWatch#start
list.description: Starts the stopwatch.

list.title: StopWatch#stop
list.description: Stops the stopwatch.

list.title: StopWatch#stopAndAdd
list.description:
Stops the stopwatch and automatically adds the measured time to the
last measured page. Logs an error if no page has been measured.

list.title: Switch#toFrame
list.description: Switches to a frame identified by its ID.

list.title: Switch#toFrameBySelector
list.description: Switches to a frame identified by a CSS selector.

list.title: Switch#toFrameByXpath
list.description: Switches to a frame identified by an XPath.

list.title: Switch#toNewTab
list.description: Opens a new tab and optionally navigates to a URL.

list.title: Switch#toNewWindow
list.description: Opens a new window and optionally navigates to a URL.

list.title: Switch#toParentFrame
list.description: Switches to the parent frame of the current frame.

list.title: Switch#toWindow
list.description: Switches to a window identified by its name.

list.title: Wait#byCondition
list.description: Waits for a JavaScript condition to return a truthy value within a maximum time.

list.title: Wait#byId
list.description: Waits for an element with a specific ID to appear within a maximum time.

list.title: Wait#byPageToComplete
list.description: Waits for the page to finish loading.

list.title: Wait#bySelector
list.description: Waits for an element located by a CSS selector to appear within a maximum time.

list.title: Wait#byTime
list.description: Waits for a specified amount of time.

list.title: Wait#byXpath
list.description: Waits for an element located by XPath to appear within a maximum time.
